{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks whether performance in selection processes predicts performance as a dental student. The relevant document is the second one, which discusses undergraduate grades, class standings, and performance in a graduate orthodontics curriculum. It states that graduate performance correlates poorly with undergraduate class standing; that relatively large differences in class standing are not generally accompanied by correspondingly large differences in grade point average; and that performance in just ten courses taken in the freshman and sophomore years predicts the final undergraduate class ranking of a student.", "answer_choice": A}
